original: @212a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @212a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: dha na d'a t'a ra s'a dha nam /
analyzed: dha na d'a t'a ra s'a dha nam /
translated: Dhanadātarasādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Attaining Tārā, Bestower of Wealth

original: sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Tārā!

original: sgrol ma ljang gu zhal gcig phyag bzhi ma //
analyzed: sgrol ma ljang gu zhal gcig phyag bzhi ma //
translated: Green Tārā, with one face and four arms,

original: spyan gnyis dang ldan kun du dga' mdzad ma //
analyzed: spyan gnyis dang ldan kun du dga' mdzad ma //
translated: with two eyes, bringing delight to all,

original: ngag gi dkyil 'khor gyi ni 'khor lo'i yang //
analyzed: ngag gi dkyil 'khor gyi ni 'khor lo'i yang //
translated: in the center of the maṇḍala of speech,

original: lha mo bcu gnyis kyang ni spyan gnyis ma //
analyzed: lha mo bcu gnyis kyang ni spyan gnyis ma //
translated: the goddess with two eyes and twelve goddesses,

original: khyad par 'phags dang rnyed par dka' ba yi //
analyzed: khyad par 'phags dang rnyed par dka' ba yi //
translated: superior and difficult to attain,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma 'phags ma sgrol ma yi //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma 'phags ma sgrol ma yi //
translated: of the Blessed Noble Tārā,

original: nor sbyin ma yi rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs //
analyzed: nor sbyin ma yi rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs //
translated: the means of attainment of the rite of Dhanada,

original: mdor bsdus pa ni legs par bdag gis bshad //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa ni legs par bdag gis bshad //
translated: I will explain well in brief.

original: rnal 'byor pas nang par snga mor byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas nang par snga mor byang chub tu sems bskyed la /
translated: The yogī, in the early morning, should generate the mind of awakening,

original: rang gi snying gar yi ge t'am sngon po blta ste /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar yi ge t'am sngon po blta ste /
translated: and look at the blue syllable tāṃ in his heart.

original: gdong bkru ba la sogs pa byas nas /
analyzed: gdong bkru ba la sogs pa byas nas /
translated: Having washed his face, and so forth,

original: aom rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ni bdag yin no zhes brjod la /
analyzed: aom rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ni bdag yin no zhes brjod la /
translated: Om amrte hum phat.

original: aom aa mri te h'um phat ces bya ba 'di dang / se gol gyis phyogs bcu'i bgegs rnams tshar bcad la /
analyzed: aom aa mri te h'um phat ces bya ba 'di dang / se gol gyis phyogs bcu'i bgegs rnams tshar bcad la /
translated: Having destroyed the obstructors in the ten directions with this and a snap of the fingers,

original: rang gi snying gar yi ge pam las byung ba'i padma dmar po'i steng du yi ge aam gis bskyed pa'i zla ba la gnas par rang nyid kyi sa bon rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar yi ge pam las byung ba'i padma dmar po'i steng du yi ge aam gis bskyed pa'i zla ba la gnas par rang nyid kyi sa bon rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: on a red lotus arisen from pam in one's heart, on a moon arisen from am, one should visualize one's own seed syllable.

original: de las spros pas spyan drangs pa'i bla ma @212b dang ; sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' la gnas pa rnams legs par mchod cing /
analyzed: de las spros pas spyan drangs pa'i bla ma @212b dang ; sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' la gnas pa rnams legs par mchod cing /
translated: Having emanated from that, one invites the gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas abiding in space, and having made offerings to them,

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa rnams kyang chog bzhin du byas shing /
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa rnams kyang chog bzhin du byas shing /
translated: one also confesses one's vile actions and so on in the proper way.

original: stong pa nyid kyang bsgoms te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang bsgoms te /
translated: One should also meditate on emptiness.

original: byin gyis kyang brlabs la /
analyzed: byin gyis kyang brlabs la /
translated: One should also bless oneself.

original: mdun du yi ge ra dmar po yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma la gnas pa'i yi ge h'um nag po las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje rnam par bltas te /
analyzed: mdun du yi ge ra dmar po yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma la gnas pa'i yi ge h'um nag po las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje rnam par bltas te /
translated: In front of that, having looked at a red letter ra, which is completely transformed, and a black letter hūṃ located on a sun, one should visualize a vajra cross arisen from that black letter hūṃ.

original: de las rdo rje 'phros pas rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang / rdo rje'i ra ba dang / rdo rje'i gur bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las rdo rje 'phros pas rdo rje'i sa gzhi dang / rdo rje'i ra ba dang / rdo rje'i gur bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: From that, vajras radiate, and one should meditate on a vajra ground, a vajra fence, and a vajra tent.🔽Then, in the center of the vajra cross, from a red letter pa arises a lotus, upon which is a white letter bhrūṃ arisen from a letter a, located on a moon.

original: de nas sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba la yi ge pa dmar po las byung ba'i padma'i steng du yi ge aa las byung ba'i zla ba la gnas pa'i bhr'um dkar po dang ba yongs su gyur pa las 'khor lo dkar po dbus na yi ge bhr'um gnas🔽pa dmigs la /
analyzed: de nas sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte ba la yi ge pa dmar po las byung ba'i padma'i steng du yi ge aa las byung ba'i zla ba la gnas pa'i bhr'um dkar po dang ba yongs su gyur pa las 'khor lo dkar po dbus na yi ge bhr'um gnas pa dmigs la /
translated: That completely transforms into a white wheel, in the center of which is a letter bhrūṃ.🔽One visualizes that and the lotus, moon, wheel, and seed completely transform into a celestial mansion.

original: padma dang zla ba dang 'khor lo dang sa bon rnams yongs su gyur pas bskyed pa'i gzhal yas khang ste /
analyzed: padma dang zla ba dang 'khor lo dang sa bon rnams yongs su gyur pas bskyed pa'i gzhal yas khang ste /
translated: It is generated from a lotus, moon, wheel, and seed.

original: thams cad kyang rin po che las gyur pa gru bzhi pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang ldan pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyang rin po che las gyur pa gru bzhi pa la sogs pa'i yon tan rnams dang ldan pa /
translated: It is also made of jewels, has four sides and so forth, and has all the good qualities.

original: rim pa gnyis pa nang rim gyi lte ba la gnas pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i snying po la zla ba tshes pas nye bar mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: rim pa gnyis pa nang rim gyi lte ba la gnas pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i snying po la zla ba tshes pas nye bar mdzes par byas pa /
translated: In the second circle, in the center of an eight-petaled lotus, is a moon crescent, which is very beautiful.

original: sgo bzhi na gnas pa'i nyi ma bzhi shin tu 'od 'phro bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi na gnas pa'i nyi ma bzhi shin tu 'od 'phro bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the four gates are four suns, which are very radiant.

original: de nas dbus kyi zla ba'i steng du sa bon gyi yi ge de nyid do //
analyzed: de nas dbus kyi zla ba'i steng du sa bon gyi yi ge de nyid do //
translated: Then, on the moon in the center, is the seed syllable.

original: de nas 'od spro ba dang bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de nas 'od spro ba dang bsdu ba'o //
translated: Then, there is the emission and re-absorption of light.

original: de nas sa bon de las bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol mar bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sa bon de las bcom ldan 'das ma sgrol mar bdag nyid bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Then, from that seed syllable, one should meditate on oneself as Bhagavatī Tārā.

original: zla ba'i gdan dang 'od zer dang ldan zhing zhi ba sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: zla ba'i gdan dang 'od zer dang ldan zhing zhi ba sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
translated: She is seated on a moon seat, with light rays, peaceful, in the sattva posture,

original: sku mdog ljang sngon zhal gcig ma /
analyzed: sku mdog ljang sngon zhal gcig ma /
translated: with a blue-green body, one face,

original: spyan gnyis phyag bzhi ma /
analyzed: spyan gnyis phyag bzhi ma /
translated: two eyes, and four arms.

original: phreng ba dang / mchog sbyin pa dang / autpala dang / po ti bsnams pa /
analyzed: phreng ba dang / mchog sbyin pa dang / autpala dang / po ti bsnams pa /
translated: She holds a rosary, a boon-granting mudrā, an utpala, and a book.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rgyan dang na bza' dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rgyan dang na bza' dang ldan pa'o //
translated: She is adorned with various ornaments and garments.

original: de nas aom ni mgo la'o //
analyzed: de nas aom ni mgo la'o //
translated: Then, the syllable oṃ is on the head.

original: t'a ni dpral bar ro //🔽re ni mig gnyis la'o //
analyzed: t'a ni dpral bar ro // re ni mig gnyis la'o //
translated: The syllable ta is on the forehead.🔽The syllable re is on the two eyes.

original: tu ni mgu la par ro //🔽tt'a ni ngag la'o //🔽re ni snying la'o //
analyzed: tu ni mgu la par ro // tt'a ni ngag la'o // re ni snying la'o //
translated: The syllable tu is on the two ears.🔽The syllable ta is on the mouth.

original: tu ni lte bar ro //
analyzed: tu ni lte bar ro //
translated: The syllable re is on the heart.🔽The syllable tu is on the navel.

original: re ni gsang bar ro //🔽sv'a ni pus mo gnyis la'o //
analyzed: re ni gsang bar ro // sv'a ni pus mo gnyis la'o //
translated: The syllable re is on the secret place.🔽The syllable sva is on the two knees.

original: h'a ni rkang pa gnyis la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: h'a ni rkang pa gnyis la dgod par bya'o //
translated: The syllable ha is on the two feet.

original: snying gar zla ba dang padma la gnas pa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis legs par bskul ba la sogs pa'i @213a * //
analyzed: snying gar zla ba dang padma la gnas pa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis legs par bskul ba la sogs pa'i @213a * //
translated: The seed syllable located on the moon and lotus in the heart is stimulated by light rays, and so forth.

original: spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis dbang bskur bar gyur pas don yod grub pa cod pan la bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams kyis dbang bskur bar gyur pas don yod grub pa cod pan la bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: The goddesses such as Locanā confer empowerment, and one should meditate on Amoghasiddhi as the head ornament.

original: de nas phyi rim la gnas pa'i zla ba la rdo rje sgrol ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams skad cig gis bltas pas /
analyzed: de nas phyi rim la gnas pa'i zla ba la rdo rje sgrol ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams skad cig gis bltas pas /
translated: Then, by merely glancing at the goddesses such as Vajratārā located on the moon in the outer circle,

original: phyi nas rnam par bsgom par bya ba las shar du rdo rje sgrol ma nag mo rdo rje phyag na bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: phyi nas rnam par bsgom par bya ba las shar du rdo rje sgrol ma nag mo rdo rje phyag na bsnams pa'o //
translated: one should subsequently meditate on them. Vajratārā is in the east, black, holding a vajra in her hand.

original: lho na rin chen sgrol ma ser mo rin po che phyag na bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: lho na rin chen sgrol ma ser mo rin po che phyag na bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the south is yellow Ratna-tārā, holding a jewel.

original: nub na padma'i sgrol ma dmar po padma dkar po phyag na bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: nub na padma'i sgrol ma dmar po padma dkar po phyag na bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the west is red Padma-tārā, holding a white lotus.

original: byang na sangs rgyas sgrol ma dkar mo 'khor lo bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: byang na sangs rgyas sgrol ma dkar mo 'khor lo bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the north is white Buddha-tārā, holding a wheel.

original: me mtshams na me tog sgrol ma dkar mo me tog gi phreng ba bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: me mtshams na me tog sgrol ma dkar mo me tog gi phreng ba bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the southeast is white Flower-tārā, holding a flower garland.

original: bden bral gyi mtshams na bdug pa'i sgrol ma nag mo phyag na spos phor bsnams pa'o //🔽rlung mtshams na mar me'i sgrol ma ser mo mar me'i snod bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: bden bral gyi mtshams na bdug pa'i sgrol ma nag mo phyag na spos phor bsnams pa'o // rlung mtshams na mar me'i sgrol ma ser mo mar me'i snod bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the southwest is black Incense-tārā, holding an incense censer.🔽In the northwest is yellow Lamp-tārā, holding a lamp.

original: dbang ldan gyi mtshams na dri'i sgrol ma dmar mo dri'i dung chos bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi mtshams na dri'i sgrol ma dmar mo dri'i dung chos bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the northeast is red Scent-tārā, holding a scent conch.

original: 'di dag rnams ni sna tshogs padma'i 'dab ma'i zla ba la ste /
analyzed: 'di dag rnams ni sna tshogs padma'i 'dab ma'i zla ba la ste /
translated: These are on moon discs in the petals of the multicolored lotus.

original: brgyad ka yang zla ba'i 'od dang ldan zhing sems dpa'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa g-yon pas autpala bsnams pa /
analyzed: brgyad ka yang zla ba'i 'od dang ldan zhing sems dpa'i skyil krung gis bzhugs pa g-yon pas autpala bsnams pa /
translated: All eight have moon-like radiance and sit in sattva posture, holding utpalas in their left hands.

original: zhal 'dzum pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyan dang na bza' dang ldan pa'o ;🔽/ shar gyi sgor ni rdo rje lcags kyu ma ste nag mo phyag na rdo rje lcags kyu bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: zhal 'dzum pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyan dang na bza' dang ldan pa'o ; / shar gyi sgor ni rdo rje lcags kyu ma ste nag mo phyag na rdo rje lcags kyu bsnams pa'o //
translated: He has a smiling face and is adorned with various ornaments and garments.🔽At the eastern gate is Vajrāṅkuśī, black, holding a vajra hook in her hand.

original: lho na ni rdo rje zhags pa ma ste ser mo rdo rje'i zhags pa phyag na bsnams pa'o //🔽nub na ni rdo rje lcags thag ma ste dmar mo rdo rje'i lcags thag bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: lho na ni rdo rje zhags pa ma ste ser mo rdo rje'i zhags pa phyag na bsnams pa'o // nub na ni rdo rje lcags thag ma ste dmar mo rdo rje'i lcags thag bsnams pa'o //
translated: At the southern gate is Vajrapāśī, yellow, holding a vajra noose in her hand.🔽At the western gate is Vajrasphoṭī, red, holding a vajra chain in her hand.

original: byang na ni rdo rje dril bu ma ste dkar mo rdo rje dril bu phyag na bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: byang na ni rdo rje dril bu ma ste dkar mo rdo rje dril bu phyag na bsnams pa'o //
translated: At the northern gate is Vajrāveśī, white, holding a vajra bell in her hand.

original: de dag rnams ni sgo bzhir nyi ma la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag rnams ni sgo bzhir nyi ma la blta bar bya ste /
translated: They should be visualized at the four gates, standing on suns.

original: nyi ma'i gzi brjid dang ldan pa /
analyzed: nyi ma'i gzi brjid dang ldan pa /
translated: They have the splendor of the sun.

original: skra ser po gyen du 'bar ba //
analyzed: skra ser po gyen du 'bar ba //
translated: Their yellow hair bristles upward.

original: g-yon bskum pa'i zhabs kyis gnas pa /
analyzed: g-yon bskum pa'i zhabs kyis gnas pa /
translated: They stand with their left legs drawn in.

original: sprul gyis brgyan cing bzhin rnam par bsgyur ba stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs bsnams pa /
analyzed: sprul gyis brgyan cing bzhin rnam par bsgyur ba stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs bsnams pa /
translated: They are adorned with snakes and have contorted faces, wearing tiger-skin skirts.

original: phyag g-yon pa rnams kyis autpala bsnams pa yin no //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa rnams kyis autpala bsnams pa yin no //
translated: Their left hands hold utpalas.

original: de nas ye shes sems dpa' dang lhan cig tu byas la /
analyzed: de nas ye shes sems dpa' dang lhan cig tu byas la /
translated: Then, having made [oneself] into the gnosis being,

original: rang gi snying ga'i padma la gnas pa'i rang gi sa bon shin tu phra ba mi g-yo ba'i yid kyis bsgoms pa sngags @213b bzlas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i padma la gnas pa'i rang gi sa bon shin tu phra ba mi g-yo ba'i yid kyis bsgoms pa sngags @213b bzlas par bya ba'o //
translated: one should meditate on the extremely subtle seed syllable of oneself abiding in the lotus of one's heart with an unwavering mind, and one should recite the mantra.

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re dha na mme da da sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re dha na mme da da sv'a h'a /
translated: Om tare tuttare ture dhanam me dehi svaha.

original: de las langs pa'i dus su ni /
analyzed: de las langs pa'i dus su ni /
translated: At the time of rising from that,

original: aom aa k'a ro mu kham zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags dang autpala'i phyag rgyas gtor ma btang la /
analyzed: aom aa k'a ro mu kham zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags dang autpala'i phyag rgyas gtor ma btang la /
translated: with the mantra Om akarosa and so forth and the utpala mudra, one should give the bali.

original: smon lam yang btab ste /
analyzed: smon lam yang btab ste /
translated: And one should also make a prayer.

original: lha'i 'khor lo rang gi sa bon gyi nang du bsdus nas /
analyzed: lha'i 'khor lo rang gi sa bon gyi nang du bsdus nas /
translated: Having gathered the wheel of the deity into one's seed syllable,

original: rang nyid kyi lha'i rnam pa dang ldan pas ji ltar bde bar rgyu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi lha'i rnam pa dang ldan pas ji ltar bde bar rgyu bar bya'o //
translated: one should move about as one pleases, endowed with the form of one's deity.

original: nyi ma phyed kyi dus dang phyi dro'i dus kyi thun dag la ni rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las skad cig gis lha'i 'khor lo kun du spros la sngar bzhin du bsgom pa dang bzlas pa la sogs pa bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyi ma phyed kyi dus dang phyi dro'i dus kyi thun dag la ni rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las skad cig gis lha'i 'khor lo kun du spros la sngar bzhin du bsgom pa dang bzlas pa la sogs pa bya ba'o //
translated: In the afternoon and evening sessions, one should instantly emanate the entire divine wheel from the seed syllable in one's heart center, and do the meditation and recitation, and so forth, as before.

original: phyi dro'i dus dang gung gi dus kyi thun la ni 'di dag khyad par yin te /
analyzed: phyi dro'i dus dang gung gi dus kyi thun la ni 'di dag khyad par yin te /
translated: In the evening and midnight sessions, there is this difference:

original: me tog la sogs pas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor legs par mchod la /
analyzed: me tog la sogs pas ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor legs par mchod la /
translated: Having made offerings to the wisdom mandala with flowers and so forth,

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re mu:zhes bya ba 'dis gshegs su gsol bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re mu:zhes bya ba 'dis gshegs su gsol bar bya ba yin no //
translated: one should request their departure with this: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture muḥ.

original: sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs so //
analyzed: sgrol ma nor sbyin ma'i sgrub thabs so //
translated: This is the sādhana of Tārā, Giver of Wealth.

original: pandi ta chen po aa bha ya'i zhal snga nas dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: pandi ta chen po aa bha ya'i zhal snga nas dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
translated: It was translated by the monk Tsültrim Gyaltsen from the instructions of the great paṇḍita Abhayākaragupta.
